author: Marcus Kwesi O'Mard
title: AHL Fight Spills Off Ice Into Locker-Room Area, Ends With Brutal Knockdown Punch | AHL | NESN.com
text:
by Marcus Kwesi O'Mard on Sun, Feb 26, 2017 at 4:57PM 2,819 Tweet 
We donâ€™t know whether Vince Dunn has made Kurtis Gabriel stop and think before he fights again. 
Dunn and Gabriel fought Saturday during an AHL game between the Chicago Wolves and the Iowa Wild. Few will forget their extended brawl, which started on the ice after but ended near the locker rooms after security guards and several other players intervened. 
The referees already had ejected both players for their on-ice fight. But Gabriel wanted more, and Dunn obliged. St. Louis Blues prospect Vince Dunn KOs a player outside the locker room ðŸ’€ðŸ’€ðŸ’€ pic.twitter.com/VDOifRCfid 
â€” Marina Molnar (@mkmolnar) February 26, 2017 
See the full scene in the video below, starting around 4:10. 
The teams will face off again Sunday. So see you in a few hours, @IAWild ? 
â€” Chicago Wolves (@Chicago_Wolves) February 26, 2017 
But donâ€™t expect similar fireworks, as the AHL suspended Gabriel pending a review of the off-ice incident, according to The Star Tribuneâ€™s Michael Russo. 
Perhaps he will have learned his lesson by the time he returns to the ice.
